intro: Lobostemon hottentoticus, commonly known as the Hottentot bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly sunbirds, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
